Using NetBSD/hpcmips

This page contains information that current and potential users of NetBSD/hpcmips can use to help them set up and maintain their systems.

Getting started with NetBSD/hpcmips

  • Finding out if your system is supported by NetBSD/hpcmips
  • Supported CF and PCMCIA cards
  • Getting the NetBSD/hpcmips distribution:
  • Getting the NetBSD/hpcmips boot loader (pbsdboot.exe)
  • Getting the NetBSD/hpcmips kernel
  • Preparing a Compact Flash card with a NetBSD partition
  • Preparing a Compact Flash card without a NetBSD partition
  • Getting support from mailing lists

Getting started with NetBSD/hpcmips

Finding out if your system is supported by NetBSD/hpcmips (top)

Supported CF and PCMCIA cards (top)
See NetBSD Mach ine-independent PCMCIA drivers.
Compact Flash Storage
over 48M CF
PCMCIA Devices cards
NE2000 compatible corega Ether PCC-T
3com 3C589*
Socket Communications,Inc. EA-2900 Standard LP-E
Xircom CF Ethernet card
TDK LAC-CF010 CF Ethernet Card
NTT DoCoMo Paldio 611S (Japan:PHS include CF Modem I/F)
Adaptec SlimSCSI card
Adaptec, Inc., APA-1460 SCSI Host Adapter
Apricorn EZ-GIG Expansion Card

Getting the NetBSD/hpcmips distribution: (top)
check ftp://ftp.netbsd.org/pub/NetBSD/arch/hpcmips/snapshot/
binary/sets:NetBSD/hpcmips binary such as base.tgz,comp.tgz..
installation:pbsdboot.exe.gz and netbsd.gz
source:source file
place pbsdboot.exe and netbsd on your CF.and exec pbsdboot.exe to start netbsd kernel includes sysinst.

Getting the NetBSD/hpcmips boot loader (pbsdboot.exe) (top)

Getting the NetBSD/hpcmips kernel (top)
pbsdboot hook up NetBSD/hpcmips kernel file.
GENERIC kernel snapshot is here.
kernel image for TX3912 machine is here.
kernel image for TX3922 machine is here.

Getting support from mailing lists (top)

pbsdboot.exe: the NetBSD/hpcmips boot loader

What is the NetBSD/hpcmips boot loader (pbsdboot.exe)? (top)

NetBSD/hpcmips boot loader options (top)
Boot loader from Windows CE
Boot loader from Windows CE environment called "pbsdboot.exe" is available from here (uuencode format).
Boot loader Options
-d break into the kernel debugger
-m use miniroot in memory
-s single user mode
-h use serial console
-a ask for name
-b=DEV change boot device to DEV(wd0,sd0,nfs etc.)

Booting the kernel with a serial console (top)
On pbsdboot,check & set these paramater:
Options: h
Serialport on
Connect your terminal with 9600bps, 8bit, non-parity, VT100 mode
pbsdboot frame buffer type setting
D8_FF : white typo on black screen
D8_00 : black typo on white screen

Configuring the frame buffer type in the boot loader (top)

One-button boot on the Everex Freestyle (top)

Everex Freestyle systems can be configured to start the boot loader at the press of a button!

To set up one-button boot loader invocation, place a copy of pbsdboot.exe in the root directory of an FAT file system on a compact flash, with the name voiceapp.exe.

To boot, just push the Freestyle "Record" button.
